info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 7:45PM CST until March 12 at 8:18AM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. Kaskaskia River at Carlyle TW. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...From late Monday night to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Agricultural levee begins to be slightly overtopped. No residences are affected at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Sunday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning to a crest of 23.0 feet Wednesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 12.3 Sun 7 pm 15.3 21.2 23.0 19.9 15.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
